member.summary:
Create a new Markdown instance and optionally load options from a configuration file. There they should be stored in the appSettings section, available options are:
Markdown.StrictBoldItalic (true/false) Markdown.EmptyElementSuffix (">" or " />" without the quotes) Markdown.LinkEmails (true/false) Markdown.AutoNewLines (true/false) Markdown.AutoHyperlink (true/false) Markdown.EncodeProblemUrlCharacters (true/false)

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.ShowControls
member.summary: Determines if min-max, clear, etc are rendered; defaults to false. For a per-page override you can use .RenderIncludes(showControls: true/false)

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.ExcludeStackTraceSnippetFromSqlTimings
member.summary: By default, SqlTimings will grab a stack trace to help locate where queries are being executed. When this setting is true, no stack trace will be collected, possibly improving profiler performance.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.IgnoredPaths
member.summary: When is called, if the current request url contains any items in this property, no profiler will be instantiated and no results will be displayed. Default value is { "/ssr-", "/content/", "/scripts/", "/favicon.ico" }.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.RouteBasePath
member.summary: The path under which ALL routes are registered in, defaults to the application root. For example, "~/myDirectory/" would yield "/myDirectory/ssr-includes.js" rather than just "/mini-profiler-includes.js" Any setting here should be in APP RELATIVE FORM, e.g. "~/myDirectory/"

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.Storage
member.summary: Understands how to save and load MiniProfilers. Used for caching between when a profiling session ends and results can be fetched to the client, and for showing shared, full-page results.
member.remarks: The normal profiling session life-cycle is as follows: 1) request begins 2) profiler is started 3) normal page/controller/request execution 4) profiler is stopped 5) profiler is cached with 's implementation of 6) request ends 7) page is displayed and profiling results are ajax-fetched down, pulling cached results from 's implementation of

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.SqlFormatter
member.summary: The formatter applied to the SQL being rendered (used only for UI)

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.UserProvider
member.summary: Provides user identification for a given profiling request.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.Version
member.summary: Assembly version of this dank MiniProfiler.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.ProfilerProvider
member.summary: The provider used to provider the current instance of a provider This is also

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.Results_Authorize
member.summary: A function that determines who can access the MiniProfiler results url. It should return true when the request client has access, false for a 401 to be returned. HttpRequest parameter is the current request and MiniProfiler parameter is the results that were profiled.
member.remarks: Both the HttpRequest and MiniProfiler parameters that will be passed into this function should never be null.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.MiniProfiler.Profiler.Settings.StopwatchProvider
member.summary: Allows switching out stopwatches for unit testing.

member.summary: Gets part of a stack trace containing only methods we care about.

member.summary: Gets the current formatted and filted stack trace.
member.returns: Space separated list of methods

member.name: M:ServiceStack.CacheAccess.Providers.MemoryCacheClient.Add``1(System.String,``0,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Add the value with key to the cache, set to expire at specified DateTime.
member.remarks: This method examines the DateTimeKind of expiresAt to determine if conversion to universal time is needed. The version of Add that takes a TimeSpan expiration is faster than using this method with a DateTime of Kind other than Utc, and is not affected by ambiguous local time during daylight savings/standard time transition.
member.param: The key of the cache entry.
The value being cached.
The DateTime at which the cache entry expires.
member.returns: True if Add succeeds, otherwise false.
